validated_hypotheses.reason: Increased spend and impressions led to a higher ROAS.
validated_hypotheses.evidence: Spend increased by 32.6% (552.93 vs 520.328571), and impressions rose by 31.9% (309257.714286 vs 234457.857143).
validated_hypotheses.recommended_action: Monitor spend and impression growth to ensure it's driving ROAS increases.

validated_hypotheses.reason: CTR increased, leading to more conversions and higher ROAS.
validated_hypotheses.evidence: CTR rose by 58.46% (0.0139 vs 0.008771), which likely contributed to the increase in conversions and ROAS.
validated_hypotheses.recommended_action: Review ad creative and targeting to optimize CTR and conversion rates.

validated_hypotheses.reason: Drift in ROAS was driven by a significant change in conversion rate.
validated_hypotheses.evidence: Conversion rate changed from -8000000.009427 (prev7) to 0.015414 (last7), which is a substantial increase.
validated_hypotheses.recommended_action: Investigate the cause of this conversion rate change and consider adjusting targeting or ad creative accordingly.
